title: Sectional Mock 8 - Quantitative Aptitude
instruction: A= >, B= <, C=≤ ,D=≥ , E = =What is the relation between Quantity I, Quantity II and Quantity III.

quiz.text: Suppose that the roots of the following equation are equal: (a-b) x2 + (b-c)x+ (c-a) = 0 Which of the following options is correct?
options: a+c=2b
a+c=b
b+c=a
b+c=2a
None of these

quiz.text: The equation kx2-6x-2=0 has real roots for
options: k ≥ -19/2
k ≥ -9/2
k ≤ -19/2
k ≤ -9/2
None of these

quiz.text: I.  5x + 4y – 20xy = 1 II.  8 + 6xy – 6x – 8y = 0
options: x > y
x ≥ y
x < y
x ≤ y
x = y or the relation cannot be established.

quiz.text: I. 5x2 – 20x + 15 = 0 II.  y + ∛0.125 = 0.9
options: x > y
x ≥ y
x < y
x ≤ y
x = y or the relation cannot be established.

quiz.text: I) x2 + 73/2 = (71/2 + 7) x II) y13 – (3439/2 / √y) = 0
options: x > y
x ≥ y
x < y
x ≤ y
x = y or the relation cannot be established

quiz.text: What is the compound interest calculated half yearly on amount given to Ram?
options: Rs. 1680
Rs. 1760
Rs. 2200
Rs. 2340
None of these

quiz.text: If person lent out total money given to Sam and Tom on simple interest to Radha on simple interest at the rate of interest 20% for 4 year, then what is the profit or loss he will have?
options: Rs. 34000
Rs. 41000
Rs. 32000
Rs. 64000
None of these

quiz.text: If person lent out money on compound interest to Raj and Ram then the total amount of money he gets is –
options: Rs. 23450.75
Rs. 28500.5
Rs. 27850.5
Rs. 21340
None of these

quiz.text: If person lent out money on simple interest to all then who will return less simple interest after completion of period?
options: Tom
Raj
Ram
Sam
None of these

quiz.text: The difference in simple interest on amount lent to Sam and on amount lent to Tom is –
options: Rs. 9600
Rs. 8800
Rs. 10500
Rs. 7800
None of these

quiz.text: A boat covers 120 km downstream in 8 hours and the same distance covers by upstream in 40 hours. If the speed of boat in still water and speed of stream is increased by 6 kmph and 4 kmph respectively, then what is the total time taken by the boat to covers 200 km in upstream and downstream?
options: 36 hours
40 hours
45 hours
48 hours
None of these

quiz.text: Circumference of a circular garden is 176 cm and the area of the circular garden is 33.33% more than the perimeter of a square park. Then find the sum of the area of circular garden and perimeter of Square Park is how much percentage of the area of the square park?
options: 5%
17%
2%
11%
None of these

quiz.text: If the ratio of the length of the train A and B is 3: 2 and the ratio of the speed of the train A to train B is 4: 3. Train A crosses train B running in same direction in 60 seconds and train B cross the pole in 8 seconds. From the statement given in the above questions which of the following can be determined. a) Length of train A b) Time taken by train B crosses the 300 m long bridge c) If train A crosses x m long platform in 36 seconds, then find the value of x? d) Train B crosses a man running in opposite direction in 6 seconds, find the speed of a man?
options: All A, B, C and D
Only A and D
Only A and C
Only A, C and D
Cannot be determined

quiz.text: An article is bought by A and B for the same price from a shop. A and B marked up by 50% and 25% more than the cost price respectively. B did not give any discount, while the discount given by A is 20 percent of the price. Find by how much percent the selling price of A is more or less than the selling price of B.
options: 4% less
10% more
10% less
4% more
4.25% less

quiz.text: A person invested a sum of the amount at the rate of 12% SI per annum for two years and received a total amount of Rs.74400. He invested the same sum at the rate x % per annum compounded annually for two years and he received interest Rs.4950 more as compared to the Simple interest, find the value of ‘x’.
options: 10 %
15 %
12 %
20 %
None of these

quiz.text: Ratio of the price of mobile to laptop is 1: 3 and then Ram purchased x number of laptops and 6 mobiles while Rahul purchased 6 laptops and x mobiles. If the difference in total amount paid by Rahul and Ram is 40%of the total amount paid by Ram, then find the value of x.
options: 4
2
3
8
6

quiz.text: In a bag, there are some red balls and some blue balls. Number of blue balls is 2 less than that of red balls. If the probability of drawing two red balls at random is 2/5, then find the probability of drawing 2 blue balls at random from the bag.
options: 1/9
2/17
1/15
2/15
1/12

quiz.text: The present age of Sanjay is twice the age of Shetty’s age after 4 years. 7 years hence, Shetty’s age will be thrice the present age of Rohit. If Anurag is 4 years older to Rohit and 1 year younger to Shetty, find the ratio of Sanjay’s age 2 years ago & Anurag’s age after 3 years.
options: 2 : 1
28: 13
28: 15
3: 1
None of these

quiz.text: The total number of male people in village A and the number of female people in village B is how much percent of the number of male and female together in village C?
options: 500%
515%
545%
315%
415%

quiz.text: If 60% of male in village B are above 40 age and 30% of females in village D are below 40 age, then find the difference between the number of male in village B above 40 and the number of females in village D above 40?
options: 240
244
230
140
340

quiz.text: Find the ratio of the number of total male in village D and E and the number of females in village B and C together.
options: 244:93
241:95
245:91
233:95
234:96

quiz.text: If 60% of females in village E are literate and 65% of females in 5 villages are illiterate, then find the percentage of literate females in village E out of the rest villages literate female?
options: 45.87%
46.66%
47.44%
56.72%
69.90%

quiz.text: The average of females in villages B, D, E is how much percent more or less than the average of male in villages A, C and E?
options: 10.24% less
11.62% less
12.64% less
14.22% more
13.24% more

22

30
36

quiz.text: Quantity I: A train starts from place A at 6 a.m. and arrives at another place at 4.30 p.m. on the same day. If the speed of the train is 40 km per hour, find the distance travelled by train? Quantity II: Speed of a car is 40 km/hr. Speed of a bus is 25% less than a car. Find the difference in distance of Car and bus when both travel 9 hour. Quantity III: A train covers 540 m in 18 sec. Find the distance travelled by train (km) in 9 hours.
options: AB
BC
DD
AA
EA

quiz.text: Quantity I: A shopkeeper sells his goods at 10% discount on the marked price. What price should he mark on an article that costs him Rs.900 to gain 10%? Quantity II: While selling a fan, a shopkeeper gives a discount of 10% on the marked price. If he gives a discount of 12%, he earns Rs.35 less as profit. Find the marked price of the fan. Quantity III: After allowing a discount of 12% on the marked price of an article, it is sold for Rs.880. Find its marked price.
options: AB
BA
DD
AA
EA

quiz.text: Quantity I: find the wrong number. 145,266,434,660,949 Quantity II: Find the wrong number. 144,147,150,155,162 Quantity III: Find the wrong number. 161,283,451,740,1101
options: AB
BC
DD
AA
EA
